table.name: db.nameval
table.desc: A table to store key/value pairs

table.name: db.logger
table.desc: Support for 'p4 logger' command. Logs any changes to changelists and jobs

table.name: db.user.rp
table.desc: Used by replica server's to store login information

table.name: db.domain
table.desc: Domains: depots, clients, labels, branches, streams, and typemap

table.name: db.view.rp
table.desc: Contains views for clients of build-server replicas

table.name: db.integed
table.keying: toFile, fromFile, startFromRev, endFromRev, startToRev, endToRev

table.name: db.integtx
table.keying: toFile, fromFile, startFromRev, endFromRev, startToRev, endToRev

table.name: db.resolvex
table.desc: Pending integration records for shelved files

table.name: db.have.rp
table.desc: Contains the 'have-list' for clients of build-server replicas

table.name: db.label
table.desc: Lists the revisions of files in labels

table.name: db.excl
table.desc: Exclusively locked files - enables coordinated file locking in a Distributed Perforce environment (commit and edge servers)

table.name: db.revdx
table.desc: Revision records for revisions deleted at the head revision

table.name: db.revhx
table.desc: Revision records for revisions NOT deleted at the head revision

table.name: db.revpx
table.note: Only populated during content trigger execution to allow triggers access to the revisions being submitted.

table.name: db.revsx
table.desc: Revision records for spec depot files

table.name: db.revux
table.desc: Revision records for unload depot files

table.name: db.changex
table.desc: Subset of db.change - records for pending changelists only
table.note: contains records for pending changelists only.

table.name: db.ixtext
table.desc: Indexing data for generic and job attributes

table.name: db.jnlack
table.desc: Tracks journal positions of all standby servers

table.name: rdb.lbr
table.desc: Replica server pending archive transfer table

table.name: tiny.db
table.desc: Records revision and content data for files using the +T file type modifier

column.name: lbrFile
column.desc: Specifies the location in the librarian's archives where the revision may be found

column.name: depotFile
column.desc: Name of the file in the depot

column.name: depotRev
column.desc: Name of the file in the depot

column.name: lbrFile
column.desc: Paths in the librarian namespace that recieve lazy copies.

column.name: depotFile
column.desc: Paths in the depot namespace that provide lazy copies.

column.name: key
column.desc: The job to which this attribute belongs

column.name: attr
column.desc: The attribute number (from the jobspec) of this attribute

column.name: key
column.desc: The job to which this attribute belongs

column.name: attr
column.desc: The attribute number (from the jobspec) of this attribute

column.name: isBulk
column.desc: Indicates whether (1), or not (0) the field is a bulk text field that should not be indexed.

column.name: descKey
column.desc: The description key. Normally the same as 'change', but may differ if a changelist was renumbered on submission.

column.name: client
column.desc: The client from which the change originates

column.name: user
column.desc: The user who owns the change

column.name: date
column.desc: Date and time the changelist was submitted

column.name: root
column.desc: Common path for all files in the changelist

column.name: extra
column.desc: For remote depots, the P4PORT address of the remote server. For spec depots, the field contains a suffix to append to the filename.

column.name: map
column.desc: The depot's map (path translation information). For local depots, this will be a path relative to the root directory. For remote depots, this will be specified in terms of the remote server's namespace.

column.name: descKey
column.desc: Original number of the change to which this description applies. This may differ from the final change number if the change is renumbered on submission.

column.name: extra
column.desc: Formerly "host". Associated host or, for labels, revision number.

column.name: owner
column.desc: Name of user who owns the domain.

column.name: updateDate
column.desc: Date of last update to domain specification.

column.name: accessDate
column.desc: Date of last access to domain specification.

column.name: options
column.desc: Options for client, label, and branch domains.

column.name: serverid
column.desc: Associated server ID for client records

column.name: partition
column.desc: Currently unused. Reserved for future use

column.name: client
column.desc: The client for which the file is locked

column.name: user
column.desc: The user for which the file is locked

column.name: date
column.desc: Date fix was recorded (may differ from date change was submitted).

column.name: client
column.desc: The client where the fix originated

column.name: user
column.desc: The user who fixed the job

column.name: type
column.desc: Type of user in this group.

column.name: timeout
column.desc: Length of time (in seconds) a login ticket remains valid.

column.name: passwordTimeout
column.desc: Length of time (in seconds) a password remains valid for users in the group.

column.name: clientFile
column.desc: The file in its location on the client

column.name: haveRev
column.desc: The revision synced to the client

column.name: type
column.desc: The filetype of the synced revision

column.name: attr
column.desc: The attribute number (from the jobspec) to which this date belongs

column.name: attr
column.desc: The attribute number to which this word belongs. For job data, the attribute number from the jobspec.

column.name: value
column.desc: For job data, a job name. For generic data, the value of the index keyed by the word.

column.name: toFile
column.desc: File to which integration is being performed (target).

column.name: fromFile
column.desc: File from which integration is being performed (source).

column.name: toRev
column.desc: Revision of toFile into which integration is being performed.

column.name: resolved
column.desc: Resolution method: unresolved, resolved manually, or resolved as part of a branch or delete.

column.name: toFile
column.desc: File to which integration is being performed (target).

column.name: fromFile
column.desc: File from which integration is being performed (source).

column.name: startToRev
column.desc: Start revision of toFile into which integration was performed.

column.name: endToRev
column.desc: End revision of toFile into which integration was performed. Only varies from startToRev for reverse integration records.

column.name: serverId
column.desc: The serverId of the standby for whom this record applies

column.name: lastUpdate
column.desc: The date and time of last update

column.name: serverType
column.desc: The server services offered by this standby

column.name: persistedJnl
column.desc: The last journal number persisted by this standby

column.name: persistedPos
column.desc: The last journal position persisted by this standby

column.name: appliedJnl
column.desc: The last journal number applied to this standby

column.name: appliedPos
column.desc: The last journal position applied to this standby

column.name: haveRev
column.desc: The revision of the file in the label

column.name: client
column.desc: Domain (client) in which file is open

column.name: user
column.desc: User who presently has the file open

column.name: action
column.desc: Action file is open for: add, edit, delete, branch, integrate, or import

column.name: change
column.desc: Changelist in which the revision is open: 0 for the default changelist

column.name: key
column.desc: Either the word 'change' or the word 'job'

column.name: attr
column.desc: The number of the change, or name of the job that was altered.

column.name: language
column.desc: The language for which this message applies

column.name: user
column.desc: Username of the user running the command

column.name: startDate
column.desc: The date and time the command started

column.name: runstate
column.desc: Flag: 0 for running, 1 for terminated, 2 for paused

column.name: host
column.desc: The IP address of the client

column.name: prog
column.desc: The name (and version) of the client program

column.name: type
column.desc: 1=user, 2=group; set if '-u | -g' option used with 'p4 property'

column.name: scope
column.desc: The user or group the property applies to

column.name: date
column.desc: The date/time the property was last updated

column.name: user
column.desc: The user that last modified the property

column.name: seq
column.desc: Sequence number: for ordering the protections table

column.name: isGroup
column.desc: Flag: 0 for a per-user setting, 1 for a per-group setting.

column.name: user
column.desc: User(s), or Group(s) for whom this record applies.

column.name: host
column.desc: Domain(s) (IP addresses) for which this record applies.

column.name: mapFlag
column.desc: Flag: Map the files in or out?

column.name: depotFile
column.desc: Files to be mapped in or out.

column.name: type
column.desc: The file type of the revision

column.name: status
column.desc: The status of the archive transfer

column.name: action
column.desc: The action that created the revision

column.name: digest
column.desc: The MD5 digest of the revision

column.name: size
column.desc: The size of the file in bytes

column.name: change
column.desc: The changelist that created the revision

column.name: pid
column.desc: The process id (PID) of the pull process

column.name: retries
column.desc: The number of retries that have occurred after transfer error

column.name: transferError
column.desc: The error message for a failed transfer

column.name: toFile
column.desc: File to which integration is being performed (target).

column.name: fromFile
column.desc: File from which integration is being performed (source).

column.name: startToRev
column.desc: Start revision of toFile into which integration was performed.

column.name: endToRev
column.desc: End revision of toFile into which integration was performed. Only varies from startToRev for reverse integration records.

column.name: state
column.desc: How the user performed the resolve.

column.name: baseFile
column.desc: File used as the base for merging.

column.name: baseRev
column.desc: Revision of baseFile used as the merge base.

column.name: type
column.desc: The file type of the revision

column.name: action
column.desc: The action that created the revision

column.name: change
column.desc: The changelist that created the revision

column.name: date
column.desc: The date/time the changelist that created the revision was submitted

column.name: modTime
column.desc: The timestamp on the file in the user's workspace when the revision was submitted.

column.name: digest
column.desc: The MD5 digest of the revision.

column.name: size
column.desc: The size of the file in bytes

column.name: traitLot
column.desc: Group of traits (attributes) associated with the revision.

column.name: lbrIsLazy
column.desc: Specifies whether or not the revision gets its content from another file (lazy copy), data about promotion of revision content from task streams, and data about revision charset information.

column.name: lbrFile
column.desc: Filename for librarian's purposes. Specifies location in the archives where the file containing the revision may be found. Usually the same as depotFile, but differs in the case of branched/copied revisions.

column.name: lbrRev
column.desc: The revision of lbrFile that contains the revision content.

column.name: lbrType
column.desc: The file type of the librarian revision. Usually the same as type, but differs in the case of branched/copied revisions.

column.name: change
column.desc: The changelist that created the revision

column.name: action
column.desc: The action that created the revision

column.name: seq
column.desc: Sequence number: used for ordering multi-line views

column.name: taskID
column.desc: The process id (PID) of the sync

column.name: clientFile
column.desc: The file in its location on the client

column.name: digest
column.desc: The MD5 digest of the revision

column.name: size
column.desc: The size of the file in bytes

column.name: lbrRev
column.desc: The revision of lbrFile that contains the revision content

column.name: lbrType
column.desc: The file type of the librarian revision

column.name: clientType
column.desc: The client file type of the revision

column.name: name
column.desc: The P4NAME used by this server

column.name: address
column.desc: The P4PORT used by this server

column.name: user
column.desc: The service user used by this server

column.name: title
column.desc: Stream title (alias for the stream name)

column.name: viewFile
column.desc: View file (left hand side of path)

column.name: depotFile
column.desc: Depot file (right hand side of path)

column.name: changeMap
column.desc: Stream 'import' path changelist specifier. The changelist limits in effect for a given client are displayed in a read-only client spec field called 'ChangeView'

column.name: traitLot
column.desc: Indicates a specific collection of traits (referred to externally as "attributes".)

column.name: seq
column.desc: Sequence number: for ordering the trigger list

column.name: mapFlag
column.desc: Type of mapping: specifies whether the trigger applies to the files or not.

column.name: depotFile
column.desc: The files to apply the trigger to

column.name: action
column.desc: Command to execute when trigger runs

column.name: updateDate
column.desc: The date/time the user record was last updated

column.name: accessDate
column.desc: The date/time the user record was last used

column.name: password
column.desc: The MD5 hash of the users (encrypted) password

column.name: strength
column.desc: Measure of the strength of the user's password

column.name: name
column.desc: Domain name to which this view applies

column.name: seq
column.desc: Sequence number: for ordering multi-line views

column.name: viewFile
column.desc: The right-hand-side of the view. For clients, this is the client-side, for labels it's the generated label view. For branches, it's the target side of the branch view.

column.name: depotFile
column.desc: The left-hand-side of the view - a mapping to file(s) in the depot.

column.name: client
column.desc: The client the file is opened on

column.name: user
column.desc: The user who has the file opened

column.name: haveRev
column.desc: Revision presently in user's client workspace

column.name: workRev
column.desc: Working revision; normally identical to the haveRev

column.name: isVirtual
column.desc: Flag: if 1, file was opened with "p4 integ -v".

column.name: action
column.desc: What the user's doing with the file

column.name: change
column.desc: Associated changelist, or zero for the default changelist.

column.name: modTime
column.desc: Modification timestamp on the file in the user's workspace.

column.name: traitLot
column.desc: Group of traits associated with file revision.

column.name: tampered
column.desc: Flag indicating the tamper-state of the file in the workspace.

column.name: clntType
column.desc: Type of the file in the client workspace.

datatype.name: Action
datatype.desc: Revisions are produced by user actions. The Action type defines the available actions and their internal values.

values.desc: purge; purged revision, no longer available

datatype.name: Change
datatype.desc: The number of a changelist. The number 0 represents the default pending changelist.

datatype.name: ChangeStatus
datatype.desc: A integer value representing the status of a change

datatype.name: Counter
datatype.desc: A string representing the counter name. Counter names must contain no spaces, contain no slashes, and be identifiers (cannot begin with a dash and cannot be all-numeric)

datatype.name: Date
datatype.desc: A date and time represented as the number of seconds since the Epoch: 01 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC. This is the same convention as that used on Unix platforms.

datatype.name: DepotType
datatype.desc: The type of a given depot

datatype.name: DescShort
datatype.desc: The first 31 characters of a Text string

datatype.name: Digest
datatype.desc: A string containing an MD5 digest.

datatype.name: Domain
datatype.desc: A string representing the name of a depot, label, client, branch, typemap, or stream.

datatype.name: DomainWild
datatype.desc: A string that may contain wildcards - usually an IP address in the protections table.

datatype.name: DomainOpts
datatype.desc: A integer value representing the options for a domain

mask.name: Domain Flags
mask.desc: Bits used to store client, label, and branch options

mask.name: Domain LineEnd
mask.desc: Bits used to store client line termination settings.

mask.name: Domain SubmitMask
mask.desc: Bits used to store client submit options

mask.name: Domain StreamMask
mask.desc: Bits used to store stream options

datatype.name: DomainType
datatype.desc: A integer value representing the type of a domain

datatype.name: File
datatype.desc: A string representing the filename

datatype.name: FileSize
datatype.desc: A 64-bit integer used to store file sizes. The value -1 is used to represent unknown filesizes.

datatype.name: FileType
datatype.desc: The FileType is a bitmask specifying the type and modifiers of a revision from both the client and server points of view. The first 16 bits are used to store the storage type and modifiers, the next 16 bits are used to store the client access method and modifiers.

mask.name: Storage Type
mask.desc: Bits used to store the server's storage type

values.desc: Detect type. Used internally when no type is given by the user.
Binary access to compressed data. Used internally.

mask.name: Storage Mods
mask.desc: Bits used to store the modifiers to the server's storage type

mask.name: Tempobj revisions
mask.desc: Bits used to store the number of revisions to be stored for +Sn files.

mask.name: Client Type
mask.desc: Bits used to store the file type from the client's point of view.

mask.name: Client Mods
mask.desc: Bits used to store the modifiers applied to the file on the client.

datatype.name: FixStatus
datatype.desc: This type is a wrapper around the 'Text' type that handles the pre-2000.1 "closed" default value.

datatype.name: Int
datatype.desc: A 32-bit integer

datatype.name: Int8
datatype.desc: An 8-bit integer: an unsigned char

datatype.name: Int64
datatype.desc: A 64-bit integer.

datatype.name: IntegHow
datatype.desc: Specifies how an integration was performed. Integrations always come in pairs: the 'forward' and 'reverse' records. As a general rule, the forward records contain the word 'from'; and the reverse records contain the word 'into'.

values.desc: merge from: integration with other changes
branch from: integration was branch of file
copy from: integration took source file whole
edit into: reverse of integration downgraded to edit
add into: reverse of branch downgraded to add
edit from: merge that the user edited
add from: branch downgraded to add
moved from: reverse of renamed file
non-deleted source ignored by 'delete' target rev
deleted source ignored by 'integrate' target rev

datatype.note: All integration records should have a corresponding reverse record. The 'branch from' (2) and 'merge from' (0) records have corresponding "dirty" reverse records for cases where the target file took more than one change or was (re)opened for 'edit' or 'add'.

datatype.name: JobStat
datatype.desc: Old (pre-98.2) job status values.

datatype.name: Key
datatype.desc: A string representing the key name. Key names must contain no spaces, contain no slashes, and be identifiers (cannot begin with a dash and cannot be all-numeric)

datatype.name: MapFlag
datatype.desc: Specifies how the files specified by a mapping should be treated

values.desc: haveMap (mappings that start with '$'). Used internally only

datatype.name: Mapping
datatype.desc: A Mapping is essentially a file name that may contain wildcards

datatype.name: MaxLockTime
datatype.summary: Maximum number of milliseconds to hold locks
datatype.desc: The number of milliseconds for which a command may hold locks. Commands that take longer than this time period will abort. The value 0 means 'unlimited'.

datatype.name: MaxResults
datatype.desc: The number of results that commands run by the restricted user are permitted to return. The value 0 means 'unlimited'.

datatype.name: MaxScanRows
datatype.desc: The maximum number of records that the server may read on behalf of the restricted user. The value 0 means 'unlimited'.

datatype.name: Octet String
datatype.desc: A variable length encoded hex string. The first octet stores the length of the string.

datatype.name: Password
datatype.summary: The MD5 hash of a password
datatype.desc: The MD5 hash of an encrypted password.

datatype.name: Perm
datatype.desc: A bitmask of granted permissions

mask.name: PermTypeBits
mask.desc: Bits used to store granted permissions

datatype.name: PullStatus
datatype.desc: The status of an archive pull transfer

datatype.name: ResolveState
datatype.desc: Pending or completed resolve actions.

datatype.name: ResolvedStatus
datatype.summary: Resolve methods (obsolete in 2011.1, replaced by ResolveState)
datatype.desc: Specifies how the user resolved merge operations.

values.desc: Resolved automatically as part of a branch
Resolved automatically as part of a delete
Resolved automatically as part of a move

datatype.name: Rev
datatype.desc: The positive integer number of a specific revision of a file. The number 0 represents '#none'.

datatype.name: RevStatus
datatype.desc: Lazy copy, task stream promotion, and charset status

mask.name: RevStatusBits
mask.desc: Bits used to store revision status

mask.name: RevCharsetBits
mask.desc: Bits used to store revision charset (high 8 bits). Value shifted right 24 bits before applying mask

datatype.name: Reviewer
datatype.desc: The type of reviewer. Currently there is only one type of reviewer and 0 is the only valid value.

datatype.name: ServerType
datatype.desc: The type of server

datatype.name: ServerServiceType
datatype.desc: One of standard, replica, broker, proxy, forwarding-replica, build-server, P4AUTH, or P4CHANGE, edge-server, commit-server, depot-master, depot-standby, workspace-server, standby, forwarding-standby.

mask.name: Service Set Value
mask.desc: The server service type setting is generated by OR'ing the generic ServerServiceProperties defined below

values.desc: replica ( db-read | db-replication | file-replication | rmt-depot | rmt-journal )
forwarding-replica ( db-read | db-replication | forwarding | file-replication | file-cacheing | rmt-depot | rmt-journal )
build-server ( db-read | db-replicaton | bound-clients | file-replication | rmt-depot | rmt-journal )
edge-server ( db-read | db-replication | bound-clients | forwarding | file-replication | file-cacheing | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | local-opens )
commit-server ( db-read | db-write | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | rmt-change | rmt-auth | commit-server )
depot-master ( db-read | db-write | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | rmt-change | rmt-auth | commit-server | p4zk-managed )
depot-standby ( db-read | db-replication | file-replication | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | journal-copy | p4zk-managed )
workspace-server ( db-read | db-replication | bound-clients | forwarding | file-replication | file-cacheing | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | local-opens | p4zk-managed )
standby ( db-read | db-replication | file-replication | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | journal-copy )
forwarding-standby ( db-read | db-replication | forwarding | file-replication | file-cacheing | rmt-depot | rmt-journal | journal-copy )

mask.name: Service Property
mask.desc: ServerServiceProperties: Bits used to identify generic server properties

datatype.name: SvrViewType
datatype.desc: Server specification view type

datatype.name: StreamStatus
datatype.desc: The stream integration status.

mask.name: Stream Status
mask.desc: Bits used to store the stream integration status

datatype.name: StreamPathType
datatype.desc: The path type for file paths in a stream view.

datatype.name: StreamType
datatype.desc: The type of stream.

datatype.name: Strength
datatype.desc: Whether or not a user's password has been tested for strength.

datatype.name: String
datatype.summary: A string up to 1024 characters long
datatype.desc: A string up to 1024 characters in length. Depending on the context in which the string is used, restrictions may apply. Strings are often used as key fields in the schema.
datatype.restriction: Cannot consist solely of a dash (-)

datatype.name: TamperCheck
datatype.desc: Indicates the tamper-state of a file in a workspace. This is used to decide whether or not to check the file, and if checked, to hold the result.

datatype.name: Text
datatype.desc: A text string value - used to hold longer blocks of text.

datatype.name: TraitLot
datatype.summary: The id of a group of traits
datatype.desc: An integer identifying a group of traits which may be shared by several revisions.

datatype.name: TraitType
datatype.desc: The type of trait.

datatype.name: Trigger
datatype.desc: The type of a trigger.

datatype.name: User
datatype.desc: The name of a Perforce user or group.

datatype.name: UserLevel
datatype.desc: User functionality level

datatype.name: UserType
datatype.summary: The role of a user within a group
datatype.desc: The role of a user (or group) within a group.

mask.name: UserTypeBits
mask.desc: Bits used to store the role of a user in a group

values.name: Owner
values.desc: User is the owner of a group

datatype.name: UserWild
datatype.summary: A user or group name with wildcards
datatype.desc: A user/group name that may contain wildcards (*)

datatype.name: Value
datatype.desc: A number, stored in a string, or a string

upgrade.desc: Split db.integ into db.integed and db.resolve
Splt db.have into db.have and db.label
Split db.change into db.change and db.changex
Move spec depot entries into db.revsx

commit_upgrade.note: Generate exclusive lock records in db.excl based on db.working data.
Promote existing shelves by updating changeStatus in db.change and db.changex.
